content.description: This is a full length climb up the right side of the cliff. From the Main Wall at the base of the cliff walk right and uphill to a small alcove with stacked blocks.P1: Climb the right facing corner on the left side of the alcove to a small roof with a crack. Pull the roof crack and follow the flakes to a final slab with a bolt. Move up to a tree anchor on the halfway tree ledge. 5.9 95P2: From the halfway tree ledge climb up a white streak in the slab above the P1 anchor to a bolt at 20 ft.  Move up to a bushy ledge with gear under the overlap. Climb straight up to a crack and follow the flakes on the left to a small ledge with gear in a horizontal. Step right and pull a steep slab to the large flake system on the right. Follow the flake into the corner system at the headwall and finish at a dbl bolt anchor* 5.7 115-120 ft  [ changed from 100ft; see below and comment of 9/11/21 ] [ * replaced the original very mossy, ugly looking tree anchor 9/11/21, see photo. Also, we rapped down this pitch with a single “70m” measured at 72 meters and had only about a meter on each end left at the mid-tree ledge. So a single 60m won’t make it, although you could probably swing left to the maple tree on White Boys and do a short rap from that. RHall NH Admin. ] P3: Step up right to a large ledge. Climb straight up the broken slab with a few gear options to a large pine tree anchor on top. 5.5 60ft (?!) [ The cut/eaten anchor was replaced 9/11/21 ….I think it’s a lot more than 60 ft from the big pine down to the P2 anchor. ]
content.location: Walk right from the base of the Main Wall to a small alcove with stacked blocks. The climb starts in the corner on the left side of the alcove.

climbs.name: White Boys
climbs.fa: FRA: Jonathan Garlough, James Dickson & Shane Soucy

content.description:
From the halfway tree ledge locate a bolt on the left a couple moves off the ground. (Also can be used to access A Walk on the White Side, recommended).  

  Climb past the bolt to a small roof under a maple tree. Clip a bolt and pull the roof (crux) climbing up on the right side of the maple tree. Continue up a moderate slab past a third bolt which leads to a headwall. Climb the left side of the headwall/arête placing gear in flakes. Finish up the slab and flakes to the tree anchor on top of White Wonder. 170'
content.location: Start on the halfway tree ledge

content.description:
This route starts the same as the second pitch of White Wonder on the halfway tree ledge.  

  Climb up the white streak to a bolt at 20. (Same as P2 of White Wonder) Move up to the small overlap with gear under it and gain a small tree ledge. Follow the crack system trending right to the base of a large left angling crack. Climb the crack until it ends and then face climb up and left with no pro to the tree anchor on P2 of White Wonder. 100
content.location: Starts on the halfway tree ledge

content.description: Start on the left side of the halfway tree ledge.  Start the same as White Boys. Clip the first bolt on White Boys and move left under the roof to a bolt. Make the crux moves over the roof and continue on the left side of a maple tree up a slab with two bolts. Continue up flakes to a small bulge (bolt) near a dying pine tree. Pull the bulge and continue up the small headwalls placing gear to the trees on top. 195'

climbs.name: A Walk on the White Side

content.description:
This route climbs the ramp on the right side of the upper headwall. It climbs to the right of  the final pitches of Trail of Tears.  

  Start on the halfway tree ledge. Scramble up and left to a small tree ledge below an overlap or start up White Boys, clip the bolt and traverse left to the small tree ledge. 

  From the small ledge (will have a tree anchor on a pine soon) climb up over an overlap (bolt coming soon) and gain a large flake/crack. Follow the crack to the ramp system that breaks left. Move left onto the face and clip a bolt. Pull over onto the slab and continue past a bolt to a small foot ledge with gear. Pull onto the last slab ramp placing gear past another bolt to ledge and finish up Trail of Tears to the tree anchor.
content.location: Left edge of the Right Wing. Starts on the left edge of the halfway tree ledge.

content.description: The "Right Wing" is located on the right side of the Main Wall. This section of cliff offers 1-3 pitch climbs and is broken by an obvious tree ledge at half height "The Halfway Tree Ledge". Many of the routes start from the halfway tree ledge.The Right Wing, much like the Main Wall, offers various styles of climbing. While no fixed protection was found on any of the climbs I would think that the wall had been explored prior to it's development by The Chinos Mountain Club in 2012.
